definition: very tired, the act of beating to windward, to wear out completely
details:
adjective
- very tired
= synonyms: drained
noun
- the act of beating to windward
- a stroke or blow
= example: a stroke or blow
- a regular rate of repetition
= example: a regular rate of repetition
- the basic rhythmic unit in a piece of music
= synonyms: rhythm, musical rhythm
- (prosody) the accent in a metrical foot of verse
= synonyms: measure
- the sound of stroke or blow
= example: the sound of stroke or blow
- the rhythmic contraction and expansion of the arteries with each heart cycle
= example: the rhythmic contraction and expansion of the arteries with each heart cycle
= synonyms: heartbeat, pulse, pulsation
- a regular route for a sentry or policeman
= example: a regular route for a sentry or policeman
= synonyms: round
- a member of the beat generation
= synonyms: beatnik
- a single pulsation of an oscillation produced by adding two waves of different frequencies
verb
- to wear out completely
= example: to wear out completely
= synonyms: exhaust, tucker, wash up, tucker out
- to be a mystery or bewildering to
= example: to be a mystery or bewildering to
= synonyms: get, pose, stick, baffle, puzzle, gravel, stupefy, perplex, mystify, vex, bewilder, flummox, nonplus, amaze, dumbfound
- to come out better in a competition, race, or conflict
= example: to come out better in a competition, race, or conflict
= synonyms: crush, shell, trounce, beat out, vanquish
- to beat through cleverness and wit
= example: to beat through cleverness and wit
= synonyms: circumvent, outwit, overreach, outsmart, outfox
- to give a beating to
= example: to give a beating to
= synonyms: work over, beat up
- to hit repeatedly
= example: to hit repeatedly
- to strike a part of one's own body repeatedly, as in great emotion or in accompaniment to music
= example: to strike a part of one's own body repeatedly, as in great emotion or in accompaniment to music
- to stir vigorously
= example: to stir vigorously
= synonyms: scramble
- to shape by beating
= example: to shape by beating
- to make by pounding or trampling
= example: to make by pounding or trampling
- to move with or as if with a regular alternating motion
= example: to move with or as if with a regular alternating motion
= synonyms: quiver, pulsate
- to move rhythmically
= example: to move rhythmically
= synonyms: thump, pound
- to sail with much tacking or with difficulty
= example: to sail with much tacking or with difficulty
- to glare or strike with great intensity
= example: to glare or strike with great intensity
- to make a rhythmic sound
= example: to make a rhythmic sound
= synonyms: drum, thrum
- to avoid paying
= example: to avoid paying
= synonyms: bunk
- to be superior
= example: to be superior
